ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a variety of modern physical chemistry techniques I had not previously had the opportunity to experience. I also became more comfortable working independently without direct supervision.

Simply put, this course taught a number of skills useful to the experimental physical chemist (electronic structure calculations, troubleshooting a program that someone else wrote, electronics, data acquisition, and obtaining/interpreting spectra). This course also taught some of the finer points of being a functioning scientist such as communication (both in writing and verbal) and troubleshooting (because nothing ever works).

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The electronics section of the course could be shortened to allow time for another section.

The relaxed timeline was helpful for me because the lower level of stress typically encourages me to engage in the material. However, this is also sort of a weakness in the course because it slows down the course pace. Overall though, I though the course was well structured and the creative aspects were helpful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This is a good course, especially if you come from a background where you had limited access instrumentation.
Dr. Johnson is a helpful and great professor.
Yes, this was a great course and I enjoyed my time taking the course. This is a necessary experience for any student intending to pursue experimental physical chemistry.
